title: Rust build failure on Solaris SPARC - error[E0093]: unrecognized intrinsic function: `read_via_copy`

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: C-discussion
labels.description: Category: Discussion or questions that doesn't represent real issues.

body:
My Rust language build (latest git sources) fails on Solaris SPARC with:
```
Building stage0 library artifacts (sparcv9-sun-solaris)
   Compiling cc v1.0.77
   Compiling core v0.0.0 (/builds2/psumbera/rust-lang-build/library/core)
   Compiling libc v0.2.139
   Compiling memchr v2.5.0
   Compiling std v0.0.0 (/builds2/psumbera/rust-lang-build/library/std)
   Compiling compiler_builtins v0.1.87
   Compiling unwind v0.0.0 (/builds2/psumbera/rust-lang-build/library/unwind)
error[E0093]: unrecognized intrinsic function: `roundevenf32`
    --> library/core/src/intrinsics.rs:1624:5
     |
1624 |     pub fn roundevenf32(x: f32) -> f32;
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ unrecognized intrinsic

error[E0093]: unrecognized intrinsic function: `roundevenf64`
    --> library/core/src/intrinsics.rs:1630:5
     |
1630 |     pub fn roundevenf64(x: f64) -> f64;
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ unrecognized intrinsic

error[E0093]: unrecognized intrinsic function: `read_via_copy`
    --> library/core/src/intrinsics.rs:2031:5
     |
2031 |     pub fn read_via_copy<T>(p: *const T) -> T;
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ unrecognized intrinsic

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0093`.
error: could not compile `core` due to 3 previous errors
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:15:48
```

I did configure it like this:
```
./configure --default-linker=gcc --enable-local-rust  --enable-extended --tools="cargo,rustfmt"
```

and have Rust 1.70-dev (from March 7th) in my PATH.

Any suggestion please? I also wonder why it downloads rustfmt-nightly-sparcv9-sun-solaris.tar.xz and rustc-nightly-sparcv9-sun-solaris.tar.xz (which I had to prepare myself) when I do use `--enable-local-rust`.
